titleStmt.title: A letter from sixteen gentlemen of Kent, named in the ordinance for the militia of that county, to the House of Commons, Saturday 16 Decemb. instant, desiring satisfaction of conscience in several things mentioned in the said ordinance, before they act thereupon. With the answer of the House thereunto. As also the remonstrance and petition of divers honest inhabitants of the city of Bristol, and the adjacent villages, to His Excellency, Thomas Lord Fairfax, and the Honorable, the Councel of the Army.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
